text: Wait...wait. Let me guess...
author: tbogg

text: My point is: get vaccinated and don’t listen to anti science anti-vaxx dumbasses. My chicken pox were discovered too late for a vaccine to be effective and I feel lucky to have been around to see my daughter grow up.
author: tbogg

text: It was easily the sickest I’ve ever  been, and the closest I ever came to shuffling off to deadland, outside of a skiing accident that should have broken my neck. Add to that, my daughter was only 7 months old and she then got the chicken pox because it is very contagious.
author: tbogg

text: I somehow managed to get the chicken pox at age 35.  Since I also got them on my eyes, I was effectively blind for six days- it was like trying to look through a fog bank.  I lost 20 pounds (I weigh about 160) and I developed pneumonia and was bedridden for almost 3 weeks.
author: tbogg
